intro: Navarretia pinnata, commonly known as the fringed bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Navarretia pinnata thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
